channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MJAVADOC-434] Running javadoc:fix corrupts files
item.project: Maven Javadoc Plugin (Moved to GitHub Issues)
item.description:
~/neo/neo-test$ mvn clean javadoc:fix && mvn compile
[INFO] Scanning for projects...
[INFO]

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: There are two separate issues here - iterative duplication of comments (see MJAVADOC-452) and corruption of code. The latter I've determined comes from a specific odd condition that the QDox library misinterprets where QDox doesn't properly set the line number where the method starts. See MJAVADOC-470.

Was already fixed in 3.0.0

Added an integration test in 30daf280bd886083120869d29d98eca9a5689130to prevent regression

Build failed in Jenkins: Maven TLP » maven-javadoc-plugin » master #91

See https://builds.apache.org/job/maven-box/job/maven-javadoc-plugin/job/master/91/

Build failed in Jenkins: Maven » Maven TLP » maven-javadoc-plugin » master #20

See https://ci-maven.apache.org/job/Maven/job/maven-box/job/maven-javadoc-plugin/job/master/20/
This project has moved from Jira to GitHub Issues. This issue was migrated to apache/maven-javadoc-plugin#725.
